author: Special Correspondent
text:
An Assistant Professor of Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute here was arrested by police after a woman student registered a complaint last month with the institute, alleging rape.

“We arrested Neeraj Mohan Sahay from Thane in Maharashtra, based on a complaint registered by a student. We produced him before a court which granted us transit remand. He is likely to be brought to the city as early as possible,” Debasish Boral, Special Additional Commissioner of Kolkata Police (Crime), told The Hindu on Wednesday.

In the compliant that was registered on December 23, 2015, the student accused the professor of the Department of Motion Picture Photography of rape.
title: SRFTI faculty member held in Thane on student rape charge
